EnablingAuthority.XRefExternal: FAMILY ORDERS AND AGREEMENTS ENFORCEMENT ASSISTANCE ACT

Identification.LongTitle: Denial of Licences for Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Regulations

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice, pursuant to subsections 67(2)a and (3)a and 72(2)a and section 78a of the Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Assistance Actb, hereby makes the annexed Denial of Licences for Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Regulations.

Section.Text: In these Regulations, Act means the Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Assistance Act.
For the purpose of subsection 67(2) of the Act, an application for licence denial shall be made in the form set out in Schedule 1 and contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a debtor, the debtor’s

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: city and country of birth, if known,

Subparagraph.Label: (xii)
Subparagraph.Text: language of choice for correspondence, if known; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the support order or support provision,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the court that issued the support order,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the support order or support provision,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the names of the parties set out in the support order or support provision, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: amount in arrears or payment periods in arrears.

Section.Text: An application referred to in section 2 shall be accompanied by an affidavit in the form set out in Schedule 2.
For the purpose of section 72 of the Act, a request for the termination of a licence denial application shall be made in the form set out in Schedule 3 and shall be made to the Minister of Justice.

Any document to be given to the Minister of Justice under section 3 or 4 can be sent to the Department of Justice, Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Assistance Unit, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0H8, by mail or by the means of electronic communication that has been agreed upon by the provincial enforcement service and the Department of Justice.
These Regulations come into force on May 1, 1997.
